docs.text: Overview passGen is a lightweight Windows app for creating randomly generated, 8-character passwords that contain: Uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers Uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols .btn { background-color: DodgerBlue; border: none; color: white; padding: 12px 30px; cursor: pointer; font-size: 20px; } <!-- ## Darker background on mouse-over --> .btn:hover { background-color: RoyalBlue; } For details about changes to passGen, see the release notes .
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: passGen is a lightweight Windows app for creating randomly generated, 8-character passwords that contain: Uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers Uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols .btn { background-color: DodgerBlue; border: none; color: white; padding: 12px 30px; cursor: pointer; font-size: 20px; } <!-- ## Darker background on mouse-over --> .btn:hover { background-color: RoyalBlue; } For details about changes to passGen, see the release notes .
docs.title: Overview

docs.text: How to create a randomly generated, 10-character password After downloading , double-click the executable file (.msi) to install the file on Windows. You can then choose which type of password to generate. Generate a password with symbols To create a 10-character password containing symbols , numbers , uppercase letters , and lowercase letters , click Create a password with symbols . Click Copy to copy the password. Note: To see the password that you generated, click the asterisks masking the password. Generate a password without symbols To create a 10-character password containing numbers , uppercase letters , and lowercase letters , click Create a password without symbols . Click Copy to copy the password. Note: To see the password that you generated, click the asterisks masking the password.
docs.title: Generating a password

docs.text: After downloading , double-click the executable file (.msi) to install the file on Windows. You can then choose which type of password to generate.
docs.title: How to create a randomly generated, 10-character password

docs.text: To create a 10-character password containing symbols , numbers , uppercase letters , and lowercase letters , click Create a password with symbols . Click Copy to copy the password. Note: To see the password that you generated, click the asterisks masking the password.
docs.title: Generate a password with symbols

docs.text: To create a 10-character password containing numbers , uppercase letters , and lowercase letters , click Create a password without symbols . Click Copy to copy the password. Note: To see the password that you generated, click the asterisks masking the password.
docs.title: Generate a password without symbols

docs.text: How to clear generated passwords To clear the passwords you generated, go to File and click Clear .
docs.title: Clearing a password

docs.text: To clear the passwords you generated, go to File and click Clear .
docs.title: How to clear generated passwords

docs.text: How to open a new window If you need to generate multiple passwords simultaneously, go to File and click Open new window to open another window.
docs.title: Opening a new window

docs.text: If you need to generate multiple passwords simultaneously, go to File and click Open new window to open another window.
docs.title: How to open a new window

docs.text: How to uninstall passGen To uninstall passGen: 1. open Settings in Windows. 2. Navigate to Add or remove programs . 3. Search for passGen in the program list. 4. Click the three vertical dots , then select Uninstall .
docs.title: Uninstalling the app

docs.text: To uninstall passGen: 1. open Settings in Windows. 2. Navigate to Add or remove programs . 3. Search for passGen in the program list. 4. Click the three vertical dots , then select Uninstall .
docs.title: How to uninstall passGen

docs.text: Contributions Did you encounter an error when using this app? Does this documentation need to be clarified, updated, or otherwise improved upon? If so, pull requests are welcome! Please do the following: Open an issue on GitHub and describe what you would like to add or change. Create a pull request and link to your issue. This will help me track changes to the documentation and help provide context for future reference.
